production.{{cite web |url = http://www.3news.co.nz/Malcolm-Websters-crimes-to-be-aired-in-drama/tabid/423/articleID/327993/Default.aspx |title = Malcolm Webster's crimes to be aired in drama |publisher = MediaWorks TV |date = 11 January 2014 |website = 3news.co.nz |accessdate= 10 April 2014 }} It was shown in New Zealand on [[TV One (New Zealand)|TV One]] in July 2014.{{cite news |url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501119&objectid=11286305 |title=TV picks of the week: Two weddings and a funeral |work=[[The New Zealand Herald]] |publisher=[[APN News & Media]] |date=3 July 2014 |accessdate=7 July 2014}} Webster's first wedding was reconstructed, based on a VHS recording provided by his first wife's family.{{cite news|last=English|first=Paul|title=Reece Shearsmith on playing wife killer Malcolm Webster in new STV drama The Widower|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/entertainment/tv-radio/reece-shearsmith-playing-wife-killer-3214179|accessdate=29 April 2014|newspaper=Daily Record|date=6 March 2014}} [[Reece Shearsmith]], who portrayed Webster, described him as a "horrible, petulant little boy ... who even now believes he has been wronged, his entire life has always been poor Malcolm, poor Malcolm, with no thought for the terrible crimes and the victims that he has left in his wake."{{cite web|title=Reece Shearsmith: Widower role not villainous|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y_I180QsP3Y|accessdate=20 April 2014}} Malcolm Webster was not approached (although his solicitor was informed that the film was being made).http://presscentre.itvstatic.com/presscentre/sites/presscentre/files/The%20Widower.pdf |accessdate=2014-08-16}} She is said to have been reluctant to take part in the project, but felt obligated due to being financially destitute.{{cite book|last1=Lavery|first1=Charles|title=The Black Widower: The life and crimes of a sociopathic killer|location=2646|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B008FY4TPU/ref=rdr_kindle_ext_tmb}} However she later discussed the series in an interview, in which she described the show as "strange to view" and criticised the show for not capturing Webster's personality which she described as "very [[extroverted]], likable, funny, amusing person to be around, he was good company", whereas in the film he was portrayed as "not at all likable", which she felt marred the show's credibility. She stated also that he would adjust his personality to a particular woman.{{Cite web|title = Felicity Drumm - former wife of murderer Malcolm Webster|url = http://www.radionz.co.nz/national/programmes/ninetonoon/audio/2602414/felicity-drumm-former-wife-of-murderer-malcolm-webster|accessdate = 2015-08-04}} Claire Webster's brother Peter Morris was reported as being impressed by Smith's portrayal of his sister, stating: "Sheridan captured Claire completely. I miss that camaraderie of a sibling and I thank Sheridan for giving that back to me for a while."{{Cite web|title = TV drama captures sister's death|url = http://www.yorkpress.co.uk/leisure/showbiz/11096473.TV_drama_captures_sister_s_death/|website = York Press|accessdate = 2015-08-04}} ==Cast== * [[Reece Shearsmith]] — [[Malcolm Webster (murderer)|Malcolm Webster]] * [[Sheridan Smith]] — Claire Webster * [[Kate Fleetwood]] — Felicity Drumm * [[Archie Panjabi]] — Simone Banerjee * [[John Hannah (actor)|John Hannah]] — DI Charlie Henry * [[James Laurenson]] — Brian Drumm * Juliet Alderice — Margaret Drumm * Fereday Holmes — Jane Drumm * [[Alex Ferns]] — DCI Neil Thompson * [[Joanna Roth]] — Trisha Heron * Paul Blair — DC Mick Jarvis ==Episodes== {{Episode table |background=#FF623B |overall= |title= |director= |writer= |airdate= |viewers= |country=UK |episodes= {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 1 |Title = Episode 1 |DirectedBy = Paul Whittington |WrittenBy = Jim Barton |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|3|17|df=y}} |Viewers = 5.84 |ShortSummary = Malcolm marries Claire. The film opens with him praising his 'darling Claire'. Shortly after they are married she requests to see all his debts. He responds by drugging her with [[Temazepam]] and murdering her in a staged [[car crash]]. Several years later he moves to [[New Zealand]] where he marries Felicity, whom he also starts drugging. He clearly plans to murder her by pushing her off a cliff but changes his mind when he finds out she is [[pregnant]]. Malcolm has no money and is in major debt, but doesn't tell Felicity. Felicity reluctantly agrees to a joint bank account with Malcolm. The episode ends with him setting fire to a chair inside Felicity’s parents' house.{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2014/03/17/the-widower-review_n_4981725.html |title='The Widower' Episode 1 Review - Reece Shearsmith, Sheridan Smith In True Tale Of Wife-Murderer Malcolm Webster |publisher=Huffingtonpost.co.uk |date=2014-03-17 |accessdate=2014-08-17}} |LineColor = FF623B }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 2 |Title = Episode 2 |DirectedBy = Paul Whittington |WrittenBy = Jim Barton |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|3|24|df=y}} |Viewers = 6.09 |ShortSummary = Everyone survives the fire. Malcolm manages to convince Felicity that she had spilt nail varnish remover on a chair, which ultimately caused the fire. She reveals to her father that her doctor is concerned about her liver (Malcolm has been drugging her). She narrowly escapes Malcolm attempting to murder her in another staged car accident. She discovers he has stolen almost her entire savings and has taken out numerous [[life insurance]] policies in her name. He returns to the United Kingdom, where he meets Simone. To gain her attention he claims to have chronic lymphatic [[leukemia]] and even shaves his head and eyebrows. Felicity has Malcolm's [[passport]] flagged, to prevent him from returning to New Zealand.{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2014/03/24/the-widower-review-episode-2-reece-shearsmith_n_5023742.html |title='The Widower' Episode 2 Review: Reece Shearsmith As Malcolm Webster Hits A New Low |publisher=Huffingtonpost.co.uk |date=2014-03-24 |accessdate=2014-08-17}} |LineColor = FF623B }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 3 |Title = Episode 3 |DirectedBy = Paul Whittington |WrittenBy = Jim Barton |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|3|31|df=y}} |Viewers = 6.42 |ShortSummary = Malcolm is now living with Simone. Charlie Henry, a Detective Inspector, is investigating him. He (Malcolm) is arrested for stealing funds from the angling club, of which he is treasurer. He is also charged with possession of a firearm without a licence and stealing a laptop. The prosecutor refuses to proceed with the first two charges and in court the third is dismissed on a technicality. An examination of Claire's [[liver]] establishes that she was drugged and a re-investigation of the hospital fire shows that Malcolm started it. This enables Charlie to re-open the investigation of Claire's death. The [[police]] present Simone with an [[Death threat#Osman warning, letter or notice|Osman letter]] telling her that Malcolm has a wife and son in New Zealand and that they believe she is in grave danger. She ends their relationship after giving him money and getting him to admit he lied about having leukemia. A year later, Malcolm is arrested for Claire's murder. Simone, a yachtswoman, is shocked to discover that Malcolm had sabotaged her [[lifejacket]].{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2014/03/31/the-widower-review-episode-3-reece-shearsmith_n_5065507.html |title='The Widower' Episode 3 Review - Malcolm Webster Finally Runs Out Of Lies |publisher=Huffingtonpost.co.uk |date=2014-03-31 |accessdate=2014-08-17}} |LineColor = FF623B }} }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb title|id=2861610|title=The Widower}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Widower, The}} [[Category:2014 British television programme debuts]] [[Category:2014 British television programme endings]] [[Category:2010s British crime drama television series]] [[Category:2010s British television miniseries]] [[Category:English-language television programs]] [[Category:ITV crime programmes]] [[Category:ITV television dramas]] [[Category:Murder in television]] [[Category:Television series about widowhood]] [[Category:Television series based on actual events]] [[Category:Television series by ITV Studios]] [[Category:Television shows set in the Republic of Ireland]]

{{Infobox Film Festival | name = The YoungCuts Film Festival | image = | caption = | host = The YoungCuts Film Festival Group | number = 100 - 200 | location = [[Montreal, Quebec]], [[Canada]] | language = International | website = http://www.youngcuts.com/ }}
'''The YoungCuts Film Festival''' is a [[Montreal]]-based international [[film festival]], whose mandate is to advance the careers of young filmmakers. ''The Festival'' was created to identify and help talented young people begin their [[film]] and [[television]] careers by providing exposure and recognition of their works. The annual event selects the best 100 films submitted by filmmakers 25 years old and under for screening at the annual festival.<ref>{{cite news |authorlink= |author= Kathryn Greenaway |title= Driven to direct |url= http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/preview/story.html?id=3aecc24e-8dbe-4e89-adbd-7a3dcbd4f198 |work= Montreal Gazette |location= |id= |pages= |page= |date= August 17, 2007 |accessdate=2010-05-05 |quote= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first= Melora |last= Koepke |title= YoungCuts Film Festival traffics in talent |url= http://www.hour.ca/film/film.aspx?iIDArticle=12698 |publisher= Montreal Hour Newspaper |pages= |page= |date= August 16, 2007 |accessdate=2010-05-05 }}</ref>
==History==
Originally launched as the ''[[Toronto International Teen Movie Festival]]'' in 2001, the event was reorganized and re-launched as ''the YoungCuts Film Festival'' in 2005. In August 2006, the festival added [[Montreal]] as a venue and became bilingual, featuring 50 films including English and French titles. ''The Festival'' began to receive more submissions from around the world.<ref>{{cite news |first= Isa |last= Tousignant |title= YoungCuts Fest is back with a new slew of up-and-comers |url=http://www.hour.ca/film/film.aspx?iIDArticle=9997 |publisher= Montreal Hour Newspaper |pages= |page= |date= August 17, 2006 |accessdate=2010-05-05 }}</ref>
In 2007, ''the Festival'' made Montreal its permanent home. ''The Festival'' also set a goal to increase the quantity and quality of films submitted to the festival. As a result, the festival expanded from 4 days to 8 and the number of films presented expanded from 50 to 100. ''The Festival'' has grown significantly since its inception, and has been actively supported by a number of television and film professionals including [[Tom Sizemore]], [[Lalaine]], [[Chris Potter (actor)|Chris Potter]], [[Maxim Roy]], and [[Frédérick De Grandpré]].
Since its inception, ''YoungCuts'' has been asked to use its expertise to recruit young film makers for various projects and competitions including the [[National Film Board]]’s “Make Shorts Not War”, ''Air Canada's en Route Film Festival'' and the ''Pepsi Access'' competitions.
''The Festival'' has received the support of a number of major companies. Its sponsors have included [[Pepsi]], [[Nokia]], [[Astral Media]], [[High Fidelity HDTV]], [[Avid Technology|Avid]], [[Quebecor]], [[Tribute (magazine)|Tribute Magazine]] and the [[City of Montreal]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.hifihdtv.ca/12-08-2008.php |title= High Fidelity HDTV Sponsors the Opening Night Gala of the YoungCuts Film Festival |accessdate=2010-05-05 |work= |publisher= High Fidelity HDTV |date= August 12, 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.colorectal-cancer.ca/en/events-and-raising/ccac-fund-events/ |title= YoungCuts Film Festival |accessdate=2010-05-05 |publisher= Canadian Colorectal Cancer Web Site |date= August 14, 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first= Kathryn |last= Greenaway |authorlink= |author= |coauthors= |title= Short, sweet and by the under-25 |url= http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/arts/story.html?id=df924843-b1e1-439a-93ef-fe68b7d05029 |publisher= Montreal Gazette Newspaper |date= August 15, 2008 |accessdate=2010-05-05 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first= Al |last= Kratina |title= YoungCuts Film Festival: Nokia Best Teen Film |url= http://communities.canada.com/montrealgazette/blogs/thecinefiles/archive/2008/08/17/youngcuts-film-festival-nokia-best-teen-film-award.aspx |publisher= Montreal Gazette Newspaper |date= August 17, 2008 |accessdate=2010-05-05 }}</ref>
''Louise Kierans'' is President of the Festival and Harvard MBA graduate ''Jay Moulton'' has been Festival Chairman since 2005.<ref>{{cite news |first= Vanessa |last= Farquharson |title= J. film Crew |url= http://www.youngcuts.com/~demo/docs/YC_NationalPost_051024.pdf |format= PDF |publisher= National Post |pages= |page= |date= October 24, 2005 |accessdate=2010-05-05 |quote= }}</ref>
In 2007, the "YoungCuts Film Festival" added a charity component to its event. Since then the Festival has raised money for the "Canadian Colorectal Cancer Association", the "Cedars Cancer Institute" and in 2011 it raised money for the charity "Leave Out Violence".
The Festival encourages participation from young filmmakers around the world. In 2009, more than one thousand films from twenty countries competed in the Festival.<ref>{{cite news |first= Julie |last= Gerber |title= Festival showcases young filmmakers' talents |url= http://www.myvirtualpaper.com/doc/The-Suburban/TheSuburbanSeptember23_2009/2009092301/76.html |publisher= Montreal Suburban |date= September 23, 2009 |accessdate=2010-05-05 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first= Al |last= Kratina |title=2009 Young Cuts Festival Begins |url= http://communities.canada.com/montrealgazette/blogs/thecinefiles/archive/2009/09/25/2009-young-cuts-film-festival-begins.aspx |publisher= Montreal Gazette |date= September 25, 2009 |accessdate=2010-05-05 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first= Chris |last= Clay |title= Filmmaker makes the cut |url= http://www.mississauga.com/what's%20on/article/151194--filmmaker-makes-the-cut |work= |publisher= Mississauga News |date= Sep 21, 2009 }}</ref> In 2010, entries were received from 30 countries.<ref>{{cite news |first= Bill |last= Brownstein |title=Bursts of Humour and Pathos |url= http://www2.canada.com/montrealgazette/columnists/story.html?id=e075c048-d681-4250-9e76-dae3d59c902c |work= |publisher= Montreal Gazette |date= Sep 24, 2010 |accessdate=2012-02-08 }}</ref> In 2011, more than 1,200 films were evaluated leading up to the Festival's 10th Anniversary celebration in September 2011.<ref>{{cite news |first= Bill |last= Brownstein |title=Young Cuts Festival 2011: Exceptional work shows floundering industry has future |url= https://montrealgazette.com/entertainment/movie-guide/Young+Cuts+Festival+2011+Exceptional+work+shows+floundering+industry+future/5478634/story.html |accessdate=2012-02-08 }}</ref> In 2012 over 1,100 films from 32 countries were evaluated. The top 100 films from various categories were screened in September 2012.
Listed in the [[IMDB]], the Festival encourages participation from young filmmakers around the world.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.imdb.com/event/ev0001479/overview |title= YoungCuts Film Festival |accessdate=2012-02-08 |publisher= Internet Movie Database Web Site |date= February 8, 2012 }}</ref> The 2013 edition was scheduled to be held in September 2013.

{{Other people|Thomas Knyvet(t)|Thomas Knyvet (disambiguation){{!}}Thomas Knyvet}} [[File:Guy fawkes henry perronet briggs.jpg|thumb|right|alt=In a stone-walled room, several armed men physically restrain another man, who is drawing his sword.|The Discovery of the Gunpowder Plot and the Taking of Guy Fawkes (c. 1823) by [[Henry Perronet Briggs]]; Knyvet wears the breastplate]] [[File:KnyvettArms.png|thumb|Arms of Knyvett: ''Argent, a bend sable a bordure engrailed of the last'']] [[File:Tomb of Lord Knyvett in Stanwell Church.JPG|thumb|Monument to Thomas Knyvet, 1st Baron Knyvet, Stanwell Church, Surrey]] [[File:Latin Inscription on Lord Knyvett's tomb Stanwell Church.JPG|thumb|Latin inscription on mural monument to Thomas Knyvet, 1st Baron Knyvet, Stanwell Church]] [[File:Stanwell LordKnyvettsSchool plaques.jpg|thumb|Founder's inscribed tablet and arms, above entrance door of ''Lord Knyvett's Free School'', High Street, Stanwell, Middlesex. Founded by the will of Thomas Knyvet, 1st Baron Knyvet. The [[cartouche]] above shows the arms of Kynvett impaling Hayward (''Gules, a lion rampant argent crowned or''), for his wife Elizabeth Hayward]] '''Thomas Knyvet, 1st Baron Knyvet''' ({{IPAc-en|n|ɪ|v|ɪ|t}}; or Knevytt, Knyvett, Knevett, Knevitt; 1545<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://kindred.stanford.edu/#/kin/full/none/none/I3415// |title=Sir Thomas Knyvett Baron Knyvett of Escrick PC - I3415 - Individual Information - PhpGedView |publisher=Stanford.edu |accessdate=2017-01-03}}</ref> – 27 July 1622) was an English courtier and Member of Parliament who played a part in foiling the [[Gunpowder Plot]].
Thomas Knyvet was the second son of Sir Henry Knyvet of [[Charlton, Brinkworth|Charlton]], [[Wiltshire]], and Anne Pickering, daughter of Sir Christopher Pickering of [[Killington, Cumbria|Killington]], [[Westmorland]]. His niece, [[Catherine Knyvet]], was married to [[Thomas Howard, 1st Earl of Suffolk]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.stanford.edu/group/auden/cgi-bin/auden/individual.php?pid=I592&ged=auden-bicknell.ged&tab=0 |title=Catherine Knyvett - I592 - Individual Information - PhpGedView |publisher=Stanford.edu |accessdate=2012-11-07}}</ref> He attended [[Jesus College, Cambridge|Jesus College]], [[University of Cambridge|Cambridge]].<ref>{{acad|id=KNVT564T|name=Knyvet, Thomas}}</ref>
He was a Gentleman of the [[Privy Chamber]] to [[Elizabeth I of England|Queen Elizabeth I]], and in 1592 was made [[Master at Arms]]. He was elected [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Thetford (UK Parliament constituency)|Thetford]] in 1601.
On 21 July 1597 Knyvet married Elizabeth Hayward, the daughter of [[Rowland Hayward|Sir Rowland Hayward]] and widow of Richard Warren of Claybury, [[Essex]]. He was granted the manor of [[Stanwell]] in 1603.<ref>{{Cite web |editor-last=Reynolds |editor-first=Susan |year=1962 |url=http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=22239 |title=Stanwell: Manors |publisher=Institute of Historical Research |work=A History of the County of Middlesex: Volume 3: Shepperton, Staines, Stanwell, Sunbury, Teddington, Heston and Isleworth, Twickenham, Cowley, Cranford, West Drayton, Greenford, Hanwell, Harefield and Harlington |accessdate=3 November 2013 }}</ref> He was knighted in 1604.<ref name=no10>{{cite web |title=Early Inhabitants of 10 Downing Street |url=http://www.number10.gov.uk/history-and-tour/early-inhabitants-2/ |publisher=UK Government |accessdate=28 October 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120129164251/http://www.number10.gov.uk/history-and-tour/early-inhabitants-2/ |archivedate=29 January 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Knyvet was the most active intervener in foiling the [[Gunpowder Plot]]. On the evening of 26 October 1605, the Catholic [[William Parker, 4th Baron Monteagle|Lord Monteagle]] received an anonymous letter warning him to stay away from Parliament during the opening, and to "retyre youre self into yowre contee whence yow maye expect the event in safti for ... they shall receyve a terrible blowe this parleament".<ref>{{Harvnb|Northcote Parkinson|1976|pp=68–69}}</ref> Monteagle's letter was shown to King James. The [[James VI and I|King]] ordered Knyvet to conduct a search of the cellars underneath Parliament, which he carried out with [[Edmund Doubleday]] in the early hours of 5 November. [[Guy Fawkes]] was arrested by Knyvet whilst leaving the cellar shortly after midnight. Inside, the barrels of gunpowder were discovered hidden under piles of firewood and coal.<ref>{{Harvnb|Northcote Parkinson|1976|p=73}}</ref>
After foiling the plot Knyvet was given charge of the education of the short-lived [[Mary Stuart (1605–1607)|Princess Mary]]. By royal grant of a peerage he entered the [[House of Lords]] as Baron Knyvet of [[Escrick]], [[Yorkshire]] in 1607. He was appointed a [[Privy Council]]lor, Member of the Council to [[Anne of Denmark|Queen Anne]], and [[Warden of the Mint]]. In 1613, the manor of [[Staines upon Thames|Staines]] was granted him outright.<ref name=sr>{{Cite web |editor-last=Reynolds |editor-first=Susan |year=1962 |url=http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=22226 |title=Staines: Manors |publisher=Institute of Historical Research |work=A History of the County of Middlesex: Volume 3: Shepperton, Staines, Stanwell, Sunbury, Teddington, Heston and Isleworth, Twickenham, Cowley, Cranford, West Drayton, Greenford, Hanwell, Harefield and Harlington |accessdate=3 November 2013 }}</ref>
He maintained a long-running feud with [[Edward de Vere, 17th Earl of Oxford]]. Knyvet's niece, [[Anne Vavasour]], was the Earl's mistress, and on 21 March 1581 bore his illegitimate son, Edward Vere. On numerous occasions, servants on either side were killed.{{citation needed|date=March 2013}} On one occasion, Knyvet injured Oxford, apparently in the leg.
When Lord Knyvet died in July 1622 his will provided for the foundation of a free-school in [[Stanwell]] — the [[Thomas Knyvett College|Lord Knyvet School]] was founded in 1624. An effigy of him and his wife features in the [[chancel]] of Stanwell's [[Church of St Mary, Stanwell|St Mary's parish church]].<ref>{{NHLE|num=1187042|accessdate=3 November 2013}}</ref>
==Knyvet House== {{see also|10 Downing Street}} Knyvet occupied as his London [[Townhouse (Great Britain)|townhouse]] the first house known on the site of [[10 Downing Street]], the modern-day residence of the [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]], in a large timber and brick building with an L-shaped garden.<ref name=no10 /> It was first leased to him in 1581 by [[Queen Elizabeth I]] at which point it became known as '''Knyvet House''', and his lifetime lease was extended in 1604 to extend to his heirs.<ref name=no10 /> The house was described by the parliamentary commissioners in 1650 as:
:“...built part wth Bricke and part wth Tymber and Flemish qalle and covered with Tyle, consistinge of a Large and spacious hall, [[wainscoting|wainscoted round]], well Lighted, and Paved wth brick Pavements, two parls whereof one is Wainscoted round from the [[wikt:ceiling|seelinge]] to ye floor, one Buttery, one seller, one Large kitchen well paved with stone and well fitted and Joynted and well fitted wth dreser boards….
:“And above stayres in the first story one large and spacious dyneinge Roome, Wainscoted round from the seelinge to the floore, well flored, Lighted and seeled, and fitted wth a faire Chimney wth a foote pace of Paynted Tyle in the same. Also 6 more Roomes and 3 Closetts in the same flore all well lighted and seeled. And in the second story 4 garretts...”
The house passed to his niece, Elizabeth Hampden, in whose lifetime, whether purposefully it adopted her surname and whose nephew was [[Oliver Cromwell]].<ref name=no10 /> After the lease expired on Hampden House and garden in 1682, [[Sir George Downing, 1st Baronet|George Downing]] redeveloped the site and adjoining premises.

{{Infobox wrestling event |name=Triplemanía XXIII |image=TriplemaniaXXIII.png |caption=Official logo of the event |tagline= |promotion=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] |date=August 9, 2015<ref name=23Announced/> |sponsor=''[[Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation]]'' |attendance= |venue=[[Mexico City Arena|Arena Ciudad de México]]<ref name=23Announced/> |city=[[Mexico City]]<ref name=23Announced/> |lastevent=[[Verano de Escándalo (2015)]] |nextevent=[[Héroes Inmortales IX]] |event=[[Triplemanía]] |lastevent2=[[Triplemanía XXII]] |nextevent2=[[Triplemanía XXIV]] }} '''Triplemanía XXIII''' was a [[professional wrestling]] [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) produced by the [[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] (AAA) [[Professional wrestling promotion|promotion]]. It took place on August 9, 2015, at [[Mexico City Arena|Arena Ciudad de México]] in [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]]. The event was the twenty-third year in a row that AAA has held a [[Triplemanía]] show, and was the thirtieth show held under the Triplemanía name since 1993 as AAA held multiple Triplemanía shows some years. The annual Triplemanía show is AAA's biggest show of the year, serving as the culmination of major storylines and feature wrestlers from all over the world competing in what has been described as AAA's version of [[WrestleMania]] or their [[Super Bowl]] event.
The main event was billed as a "Dream match" between two of the biggest names in ''lucha libre'', a [[Professional wrestling match types#Variations of singles matches|singles match]] between [[Rey Mysterio|Rey Mysterio Jr.]] and [[Myzteziz]]. A second match, a ''[[Lucha de Apuestas]]'' "hair vs. hair" match between [[Alberto Del Rio|El Patrón Alberto]] and [[Brian Cage]] was confirmed at the AAA television taping on July 10. The show was the final mach of ''lucha libre'' legend [[Villano III]] as he teamed up with his brothers [[Villano IV]] and [[Villano V]] to take on ''[[Los Psycho Circus]]'' and three additional matches. The show received very negative reviews both due to technical difficulties throughout the show and the quality of several of the matches on the show.
==Production==
===Background=== 2015 marked the 23rd year since 1993 where the Mexican [[wrestling promotion|professional wrestling company]] [[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] (AAA) held their annual [[Triplemanía]] show and the thirtieth Triplemanía show promoted by AAA as they held multiple Triplemanía shows over the summers of 1994 to 1997. The event took place at the [[Mexico City Arena|Arena Ciudad de México]] (Mexico City Arena) an indoor [[arena]] in [[Azcapotzalco]], [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] that has a maximum capacity of 22,300 spectators.<ref name=23Announced/> AAA previously held [[Triplemanía XX]], [[Triplemanía XXI]] and [[Triplemanía XXII]] having held Triplemanía at the arena since its completion in 2012.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://superluchas.net/triplemania-xx-el-dia-ha-llegado-cobertura-y-resultados-5-de-agosto-de-2012-mascara-vs-mascara-dr-wagner-vs-mascara-ano-2000-jr-kurt-angle-en-mexico/ | title = Triplemania XX "El día ha llegado" (Cobertura y resultados 5 de agosto de 2012) – Máscara vs máscara: Dr. Wagner vs Máscara Año 2000 Jr. – ¡Kurt Angle en México! | date=August 5, 2012 | accessdate=August 5, 2012 | last=Cano Vela | first=Eduardo | work=SuperLuchas | language = Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://superluchas.net/2013/03/06/aaa-triplemania-xxi-este-16jun-en-la-arena-ciudad-de-mexico/ | title=¡AAA Triplemanía XXI!… este 16/Jun en la Arena Ciudad de México – Dorian Roldán lo confirma | date=March 6, 2013 | accessdate=March 24, 2013 | publisher=SuperLuchas Magazine | language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.luchalibreaaa.com/carteleraaaa/item/1562-agosto-17-tripleman%C3%ADa-xxii-arena-ciudad-de-m%C3%A9xico-distrito-federal.html | title = Agosto 17 - Triplemanía XXII - Arena Ciudad de México, Distrito Federal | accessdate=July 26, 2014 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> AAA's Triplemanía is their biggest show of the year, the highlight of their year, AAA's equivalence of the [[WWE]]'s [[WrestleMania]] or their [[Super Bowl]] event.<ref>{{cite book|author=Madigan, Dan|title=Mondo Lucha Libre: the bizarre and honorable world of wild Mexican wrestling|publisher=HarperColins Publisher|year=2007|chapter=A family affair|pages=128–132|isbn=978-0-06-085583-3}}</ref>
===Storylines=== The Triplemanía XXIII show featured six [[Professional wrestling match types|professional wrestling matches]] with different wrestlers involved in pre-existing [[Screenplay|scripted]] feuds, [[plot (narrative)|plots]] and [[narrative thread|storylines]]. Wrestlers portrayed either [[Heel (professional wrestling)|heels]] (referred to as ''rudos'' in Mexico, those that portray the "bad guys") or [[Face (professional wrestling)|faces]] (''técnicos'' in Mexico, the "good guy" characters) as they followed a series of tension-building events, which culminated in a wrestling match or series of matches. On July 1, 2015, AAA Vice President Dorian Roldán announced via [[Twitter]] that the 23rd annual Triplemanía show would be held on August 9 in [[Mexico City Arena|Arena Ciudad de México]] in [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]].<ref name=23Announced>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2015/06/30/triplemania-xxiii-9-de-agosto-en-la-ciudad-de-mexico | title=Triplemanía XXIII, 9 de agosto en la Ciudad de México | date=June 30, 2015 | accessdate=July 1, 2015 |publisher=[[MSN]] | work=MedioTiempo | language=Spanish}}</ref> The show was announced as being available on Internet [[pay-per-view]] both in and outside of Mexico.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://internetvluchalibreaaa.com/ | title=Internet TV Lucha Libre AAA | accessdate=July 10, 2015 | language=Spanish}}</ref> On July 22, it was announced that the event would also be available on cable and satellite PPV in the United States and Canada, making it the first AAA event to air live on American PPV since [[AAA When Worlds Collide|When Worlds Collide]] in 1994.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/101-mexico/43679-triplemania-to-be-on-us-and-canadian-ppv | title=TripleMania to be on U.S. and Canadian PPV | work=[[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]] | date=July 22, 2015 | accessdate=July 22, 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Mysterio RAW 800.jpg|left|thumb|[[Rey Mysterio|Rey Mysterio Jr.]] (in 2011) part of the "Dream Match" main event against [[Místico|Myzteziz]]]] Ever since [[Myzteziz]] (then known as Místico) rise in popularity early in the 21st century parallels were drawn between ''El Principe de Oro y Plata'' ("The Prince of Gold and Silver") and [[Rey Mysterio|Rey Mysterio Jr.]] both in regards to their ring style, skill level and popularity.<ref name=MainEventAnnounced>{{cite web | url=http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2283-rey-mysterio-vs-myzteziz-en-tripleman%C3%ADa-xxiii.html | title=Rey Mysterio vs Myzteziz ej Triplemanía XXIII | publisher=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | date=July 10, 2015 | accessdate=July 10, 2015 | language=Spanish}}</ref><ref name=MedioMain>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2015/07/10/myzteziz-vs-rey-mysterio-en-triplemania-xxiii | title=Myzteziz vs. Rey Mysterio en Triplemanía XXIII | date=July 10, 2015 | accessdate=July 10, 2015 | work=MedioTiempo | publisher=[[MSN]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> Myzteziz would become the most popular ''Luchador'' in Mexico during the first decade of the 21st century while Rey Mysterio would become the most popular ''luchador'' outside of Mexico in the same time period.<ref name=MainEventAnnounced/> When Myzteziz joined the [[WWE]] under the name [[Sin Cara]] in 2011, the idea that the two could face off became a possibility. By mid-2012 wrestling magazine and news websites reported rumors of a Rey Mysterio/Sin Cara possibly taking place at [[WrestleMania 28]] but due to injuries to Rey Mysterio the match did not happen.<ref name=WM28and29>{{cite web | url=http://superluchas.com/2012/12/17/rey-mysterio-vs-sin-cara-el-dream-match-debe-o-no-debe-ser-en-wrestlemania/ | title=Rey Mysterio Vs Sin Cara el Dream Match debe o no dee ser en WrestleMania | date=December 17, 2012 | accessdate=July 10, 2015 | first=Cesar | last=Barrera | work=SuperLuchas Magazine}}</ref> When Mysterio returned from his injuries in later 2012 he began teaming with Sin Cara on a regular basis, leading once again to speculations that the two might wrestle each other at [[WrestleMania 29]], possibly in a ''[[Lucha libre#Luchas de Apuestas|Lucha de Apuestas]]'', or bet match with their masks on the line.<ref name=WM28and29/> The duo teamed regularly throughout the second half of 2012, including a tournament to determine the #1 contenders for the [[WWE Raw Tag Team Championship|WWE Tag Team Championship]], a tournament that Rey Mysterio and Sin Cara lost in the finals to "The Rhodes Scholars" ([[Cody Rhodes]] and [[Damian Sandow]]) at the 2012 [[TLC: Tables, Ladders and Chairs (2012)|TLC: Tables, Ladders and Chairs]] [[pay-per-view]].<ref name="ScholarsMysterioCara">{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwetlc/2012/rey-mysterio-sin-cara-team-rhodes-scholars-26075318|title=Rey Mysterio & Sin Cara vs. Team Rhodes Scholars|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=July 10, 2015}}</ref> In the wake of their loss rumors of a WrestleMania 29 match arose again, this time with the added rumors that the WWE wanted to use the match to set a record for the most masked fans in one location as well as transitioning the role of the WWE's top Latino wrestler from Rey Mysterio to Sin Cara.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://superluchas.com/2013/02/15/wwe-recuerda-las-luchas-donde-se-han-apostado-mascaras-en-estados-unidos-rey-mysterio-vs-sin-cara-por-las-mascaras-para-wrestlemania-29/ | title=WWE recuerda las luchas donde se han apostado mascaras en Estados Unidos ¿Rey Mysterio vs Sin Cara por las máscaras para Wrestlemania 29? | date=February 15, 2013 | first=Alex | last=Ruiz | work=SuperLuchas Magazine | language=Spanish}}</ref> Unfortunately Mysterio was forced to take time off once again in March 2013 due to another knee injury.<ref>{{cite web|title=WWE News: Update on Mysterio's latest knee injury|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/WWE_News_3/article_69076.shtml}}</ref> At this point in time it was reported that Rey Mysterio did not intend to sign another contract with the WWE, putting an end to the rumored Rey Mysterio vs Sin Cara match for the time being. In 2014 Sin Cara left the WWE and began working for AAA in Mexico under the name Myzteziz.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Meltzer|first=Dave|authorlink=Dave Meltzer|date=February 24, 2014|title=Feb 24 2014 Wrestling Observer Newsletter: WWE TV deal up for grabs, WWE Network launching next week, Viscera passes away, CM Punk story, tons more|journal=[[Dave Meltzer#Wrestling Observer Newsletter|Wrestling Observer Newsletter]]|location=[[Campbell, California]]|issn=1083-9593|page=35|url=http://www.f4wonline.com/component/content/article/35523-feb-24-2014-wrestling-observer-newsletter-wwe-tv-deal-up-for-grabs-wwe-network-launching-next-week-viscera-passes-away-cm-punk-story-tons-more-}}</ref> In February 2015 the WWE announced that Rey Mysterio's contract had expired.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pwinsider.com/article/91914/official-wwe-statement-on-rey-mysterio.html|title=Official WWE statement on Rey Mysterio|last=Johnson|first=Mike|publisher=PWInsider|date=February 26, 2015|accessdate=February 26, 2015}}</ref> A few days later it was announced that he had signed with AAA and would team up with Myzteziz in the main event of the 2015 [[Rey de Reyes (2015)|Rey de Reyes]] ("King of Kings") show against [[El Hijo del Perro Aguayo]] and [[Pentagón Jr.]], a match that the reunited team of Mysterio and Myzteziz won when Mysterio Jr. scored the pin.<ref name=RDRCard2015>{{cite web | url=http://www.luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2097-cartel-completo-rey-de-reyes-2015.html | title=Cartel Completo: Rey de Reyes 2015 | publisher=Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide | language=Spanish | accessdate=March 5, 2015}}</ref> On May 24, 2015 Myzteziz, Rey Mysterio Jr. and [[Alberto Del Rio|El Patrón Alberto]] formed a "Dream team" to win the [[Lucha Libre World Cup]].<ref name=LuchaWorldCupWV>{{cite web | url = http://www.wrestleview.com/misc-news/54563-aaa-lucha-libre-world-cup-results-5-24-15-live-ippv-results | title = AAA Lucha Libre World Cup Results - 5/24/15 (Live results) | last=Boutwell | first=Josh | date=May 24, 2015 | accessdate=May 24, 2015 | work=Wrestleview}}</ref> On July 10, 2015 AAA announced that the "dream match" between Rey Mysterio Jr. and Myzteziz would finally take place and that it would be the main event of Triplemanía XXIII.<ref name=MainEventAnnounced/>
[[File:Alberto Del Rio.jpg|right|thumb|[[Alberto Del Rio|El Patrón Alberto]] who risked his hair at Triplemanía XXIII against [[Brian Cage]]]] In early 2015 [[AAA Mega Championship|AAA Mega Champion]] El Patrón Alberto found himself with an American "invader" challenging him in the form of [[Brian Cage]], who had worked indirectly for AAA through [[Lucha Underground]] up until that point. Cage was immediately positioned as a challenger for El Patrón as he, [[El Hijo de Fantasma]] and [[Pentagón Jr.]] defeated El Patrón Alberto, [[Fénix (wrestler)|Fénix]] and [[Místico|Myzteziz]] in his AAA debut match on February 27 when Cage pinned Alberto.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2015/02/28/brian-cage-destrozo-al-patron-alberto | title=Brian Cage destrozó al Patrón Alberto | date=February 28, 2015 | accessdate=July 11, 2015 | work=MedioTiempo | language=Spanish | publisher=[[MSN]]}}</ref> El Patrón was scheduled to defend the Mega Championship against Cage as part of the 2015 [[Rey de Reyes (2015)|Rey de Reyes]] show slated for March 15.<ref name="RDRCard2015"/> however, when Guadalajara was hit with a rainstorm, AAA postponed the event for 24 hours and moved it indoors to ''Auditorio Benito Juarez'' in Zapopan, Jalisco.<ref name=RDRPostponed>{{cite web | url=http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/118-daily-updates/41647-rey-de-reyes-postponed-due-to-storm | title=Rey de Reyes postponed due to storm | last=Meltzer | first=Dave | authorlink=Dave Meltzer | work=[[Dave Meltzer#Wrestling Observer Newsletter|Wrestling Observer Newsletter]] | date=March 15, 2015 | accessdate=March 16, 2015}}</ref> The following day AAA announced that they were not able to get all permits in time for the show due to it being it being a national holiday, and once again postponed the show to Wednesday March 18 instead. At the same time they announced that the announced match between [[Alberto Del Rio|El Patrón Alberto]] and [[Brian Cage]] had been cancelled.<ref name=RDRPostponedAgain>{{cite web | url=http://superluchas.com/2015/03/16/ultima-hora-aaa-rey-de-reyes-se-pospone-de-nuevo-para-el-miercoles-18-de-marzo/ | title=Última Hora: De nuevo AAA Rey de Reyes se pospone | date=March 16, 2015 | accessdate=March 16, 2015 | first=Eduardo | last=Cano Vela | work=SuperLuchas | language=Spanish}}</ref> El Patrón Alberto later stated that he was legally obligated to compete in Australia later in the week and thus was not able to work the Wednesday show for AAA.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://twitter.com/VivaDelRio/status/577812456342343681 | title=Aficionados @luchalibreaaa | date=March 17, 2015 | author=VivaDelRio | accessdate=March 17, 2015 | publisher=[[Twitter]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> On April 1 Cage defeated El Patrón in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Hardcore-based variations|Street Fight]] after members of ''[[La Sociedad]]'' interfered in the match to help Cage win the match, after which Cage once again challenged El Patrón to the title match he never received.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2015/04/02/brian-cage-volvio-a-humillar-al-patron-alberto | title=Brian Cage volvió a humillar al Patrón Alberto | date=April 2, 2015 | accessdate=July 11, 2015 | work=MedioTiempo | publisher=[[MSN]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> A few weeks later the two faced off again in a one-on-one match, but this time it ended in a no-contest after interference from [[Dark Cuervo]] and [[Dark Scoria]], which then brough out [[Jack Evans (wrestler)|Jack Evans]] and [[Angélico]] turning it into a [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Trios rules (Relevos Australianos)|six-man tag team match]] that El Patrón, Evans and Angélico won when El Patrón pinned Cage.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2191-resultados-tapachula-chiapas-abril-2015.html | title=Resultados Tapachula, Chiapas - Abril 2015 | date=April 30, 2015 | accessdate=July 11, 2015 | publisher=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> The two rivals found themselves on opposite sides in the [[Lucha Libre World Cup]], with the "Dream team" of El Patrón, Rey Mysterio Jr. and Myzteziz defeated the team of Cage and [[Ring of Honor]] representatives [[Quinn Ojinnaka|Moose]] and [[ACH (wrestler)|ACH]] in the second round of the tournament.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2212-%C2%A1victoria-para-m%C3%A9xico.html | title=¡Victoria para México! | accessdate=May 26, 2015 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> El Patrón was finally able to defend the Mega Championship against Cage at AAA's 2015 [[Verano de Escándalo (2015)|Verano de Escándalo]] show. The match saw interference from Cage's corner man [[El Texano Jr.]] as well as the ''rudo'' referee El Hijo del Tirantes favoring Cage throughout the match to stack the odds against El Patrón in the end a second, impartial referee came to the ring and declared a disqualification, leaving the issues between the two unresolved.<ref name="HellBrothers"/> After the match an enraged El Patrón Alberto laid out a challenge for a ''Lucha de Apuestas'' match against Cage, stating that he did not care if he had to put his title on the line, wrestle in a [[Steel Cage match|steel cage]] or whatever it would take to get Cage to put his hair on the line in a match. Next AAA paired up El Patrón and Cage to fight against [[Blue Demon Jr.]] and [[Villano IV]] in a ''[[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Parejas Suicidas|Pareja Increibles]]'' ("Incredible pairs") match, forcing two sets of rivals to team up for a match. As expected El Patrón and Cage were not able to get along, with Cage attacking El Patrón and throwing him through a table at ringside to allow Blue Demon Jr. and Villano IV to win the match.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2015/07/05/el-patron-exigio-apuesta-contra-brian-cage | title=El Patrón exigió apuesta contra Brian Cage | date=July 5, 2015 | accessdate=July 11, 2015 | work=MedioTiempo | publisher=[[MSN]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> On the AAA television taping on July 10, 2015 Cage accepted the ''Lucha de Apuestas'' challenge made repeatedly by El Patrón Alberto.<ref name=ApuestaAnnounced>{{cite web | url=http://www.luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2288-reto-de-cabelleras-en-puebla.html | title=Reto de Caballeras en Puebla | date=July 10, 2015 | accessdate=July 11, 2015 | publisher=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> During the English language "Triplemanía XXIII Countdown Special" it was revealed that Alberto had stated that if he lost to Brian Cage he would leave AAA.<ref>{{cite episode | time=09:50 | title=Triplemanía XXIII Countdown Special | series= AAA English Language | publisher=[[YouTube]] | date=August 2, 2015}}</ref>
On June 26 [[Goya Kong]] left [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] (CMLL) and joined AAA instead, being introduced to the AAA crowd by her brother, [[Psycho Clown]], before the match. After the match [[Villano IV]] interrupted the celebrations, claiming that his family, the Mendoza family, also known as ''La Dinastia Imperial'' ("The Imperial Dynasty"; Villano and his brothers) was better than the [[Alvarado wrestling family|Alvarado family]] that both Goya Kong and Psycho Clown belonged to.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2263-resultados-orizaba-veracruz-junio-2015.html | title=Resultados: Oriziba, Veracruz Junio/2015 | date=June 26, 2015 | accessdate=July 18, 2015 | publisher=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> Villano IV's claim was built on the decade long rivalry between various members of ''Los Villano'', including a match where [[Villano I]], IV and [[Villano V]] defeated [[Brazo de Plata]] (Goya Kong and Psycho Clown's father), [[Brazo de Oro (wrestler)|Brazo de Oro]] and [[El Brazo]] to unmask the trio back in 1988.<ref>{{cite news|title=Enciclopedia de las Mascaras|work=Brazo, Brazo de Oro, Brazo de Plata|location=[[Mexico]]|id=Tomo I|pages=39–41|date=July 2007|language=Spanish}}</ref> Following the match Psycho Clown stated that the Alvarado family was always ready to fight and would be happy to face either Villano IV on his own or any member of the Villano family in the ring.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2015/07/14/villano-iv-esta-jugando-con-fuego-psycho-clown | title=Villano IV está jugando con fuego: Psycho Clown | date=July 14, 2015 | accessdate=July 18, 2015 | work=MedioTiempo | publisher=[[MSN]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> On July 18, 2015 AAA announced that ''[[Los Psycho Circus]]'', Psycho Clown, [[Murder Clown]] and [[Monster Clown]] would face the trio of Villano III, IV and V at Triplemanía. The match was promoted as both another chapter in the Alvarado/Mendoza family feud as well as Villano III's retirement match after 45 years as a wrestler.<ref name=ThirdMatchAnnounced>{{cite web | url=http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2296-villano-iii-dir%C3%A1-adi%C3%B3s-en-tripleman%C3%ADa-xxiii.html | title=Villano III dirá adiós en Triplemania XVIII | date=July 17, 2015 | accessdate=July 17, 2015 | publisher=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> On July 24, 2015 AAA announced that the event would also be the farewell to referee [[Pepe Casas|Pepe "Tropi" Casas]] who had worked for AAA since its inception in 1992.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://twitter.com/AAALucha/status/624701635613335552 | title=See a farewell to the legendary Villano III at #TriplemaniaXXIII live on PPV 7pm ET on August 9th! | date=July 24, 2015 | accessdate=July 24, 2015 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | publisher=[[Twitter]]}}</ref>
AAA announced that to commemorate the 30th anniversary of the debut of [[Blue Demon Jr.]] on July 26, 1985 AAA booked Demon Jr. in a [[tag team]] match where he would team up with [[La Parka II|La Parka]] to face off against [[El Mesias]] and [[Electroshock (wrestler)|Electroshock]] as part of the 23rd Triplemanía event.<ref name=Demon30>{{cite web | url=https://twitter.com/luchalibreaaa/status/624749116556378114 | title=¡CONFIRMADO! | date=July 24, 2015 | accessdate=July 24, 2015 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | publisher=[[Twitter]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> While there was no ongoing storyline at the time of the match being announced the four wrestlers were no strangers to each other, with them all facing off at Triplemanía XXII in a six-man steel cage match where the last man in the cage would be shaved bald. The mach also included [[Averno (wrestler)|Averno]] and [[Chessman (wrestler)|Chessman]] and ended with El Mesias being the last to escape the cage, forcing Electroshock to have his hair shaved off.<ref name=ViewResults>{{cite web | url = http://www.wrestleview.com/featured-articles/50386-feature-viva-la-raza-lucha-weekly-for-8-25-14 | title = Viva la Raza! Lucha Weekly for 8/25/14 | last=Boutwell | first=Josh | date=August 25, 2014 | accessdate=August 25, 2014 | work=Wrestleview}}</ref> The AAA preview for the match did point out that a year ago El Mesias and Electroshock were both ''tecnicos'' and on the same side until the end of the cage match.<ref name=Demon30/>
On June 14, 2015 ''Los Hell Brothers'' (Averno, Chessman and [[Cibernético]]) defeated ''Los Psycho Circus'' and ''Holocausto'' (Electroshock, [[El Hijo de Pirata Morgan]] and [[La Parka Negra II|La Parka Negra]]) to win the [[AAA World Trios Championship]] as part of the 2015 [[Verano de Escándalo (2015)|Verano de Escándalo]] ("Summer of Scandal") show.<ref name=HellBrothers>{{cite web | url=http://pwinsider.com/article/94403/rey-alberto-and-more-aaa-verano-de-escandalo-ippv-results.html?p=1 | title=Rey, Alberto and more: AAA Verano de Escandalo iPPV results | last=Zellner | first=Kris | date=June 14, 2015 | accessdate=June 14, 2015 | work=Pro Wrestling Insider}}</ref> On July 28, 2015 AAA Announced that ''Los Hell Brothers'' would face off against ''Los Güeros del Cielo'' ("The Sky Blondes"; [[Angélico]] and [[Jack Evans (wrestler)|Jack Evans]]) teaming with [[Fénix (wrestler)|Fénix]] as well as the trio of El Hijo del Fantasma, [[El Texano Jr.]] and [[Pentagón Jr.]] as they defend the AAA World Trios Championship at Triplemanía.<ref name=FifthMatch>{{cite web | url=http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/2302-campeonato-de-tercias-aaa-en-juego-en-tripleman%C3%ADa-xxiii.html | title=Campeonato de Tercias AAA en juego en Triplemanía XXIII | date=July 28, 2015 | accessdate=July 28, 2015 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref> Prior to the show Fénix and ''Los Güeros del Cielo'' had not teamed up on a regular basis while Hijo del Fantasma, Texano Jr. and Pentagón Jr. had all been members of the group ''[[Los Perros del Mal]]'' and teamed together on occasion. With the death of El Hijo del Perro Aguayo earlier in 2015 the future of ''Los Perros del Mal'' under that name was in question and while not officially announced as ''Los Perros del Mal'' they kept wearing the ''Perros del Mal'' shirts. At the time of the announcement El Hijo del Fantasma held the [[AAA World Cruiserweight Championship]] while Pentagón Jr. was one half of both the [[AAA World Tag Team Championship]] team (with [[Joe Lider]]) and the [[AAA World Mixed Tag Team Championship]] (with [[Sexy Star]]).<ref name=CW8>{{cite web | url = http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/1658-noche-de-leyenda-en-tripleman%C3%ADa-xxii.html | title = Noche de Leyenda en Triplemanía XXII | date=August 18, 2014 | accessdate=August 18, 2014 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url= http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/1672-hijo-del-fantasma-primer-campe%C3%B3n-mundial-crucero-aaa.html | title= Hijo del Fantasma, primer Campeón Mundial Crucero AAA | date=August 21, 2014 | accessdate=August 21, 2014 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref><ref name=LiderPentagon>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2014/12/07/aerostar-desenmascaro-a-super-fly|title=Aerostar desenmascaró a Súper Fly|date=December 7, 2014|accessdate=December 7, 2014|work=MedioTiempo|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref name=MixedTag13>{{cite web | url= http://luchalibreaaa.com/noticiasaaa/item/1390-comienza-un-nuevo-reinado-en-el-juan-de-la-barrera.html | title=Comienza un nuevo reinado en el Juan de la Barrera | date=April 20, 2014 | accessdate=April 20, 2014 | work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]] | language=Spanish}}</ref>
AAA has traditionally included a [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Multiple man teamed matches|''Relevos Atómicos de Locura'']], or "Atomic Madness" match as part of their major shows for years as a homage to AAA founder [[Antonio Peña]] who created the concept years prior. In a ''Relevos Atómicos de Locura'' match each team represents the four distinct type of wrestlers that work for AAA, Male, Female, ''[[Mini-Estrella]]'' and ''[[Exótico]]''. While the match is a mixed-gender match there are no rules to limit the interaction between the teams so males wrestle females, ''Mini-Estrellas'' wrestle ''Exótico'' and so on. For the 2015 show AAA paired up [[Drago (wrestler)|Drago]] (male), [[Goya Kong]] (female), [[Dinastía]] (''Mini-Estrella'' and [[AAA World Mini-Estrella Championship|AAA World Mini-Estrella Champion]]) and [[Pimpinela Escarlata]] (''Exótico'') on the '''tecnico'' side to take on [[Daga (wrestler)|Daga]] (male), [[Sexy Star]] (female), [[Mini Psycho Clown]] (''Mini-Estrella'') and [[Mamba (wrestler)|Mamba]] (''Exótico''). The two ''Exótico'' had fought on opposite sides of various ''Relevos Atómicos de Locura'' matches for years, as far back as the 2014 [[Rey de Reyes (2014)|Rey de Reyes]] ("King of Kings").<ref name=RdR2014MT>{{cite web | url = http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2014/03/04/listo-el-cartel-de-rey-de-reyes | title = Listo el cartel de Rey de Reyes | date=March 4, 2014 | accessdate=March 5, 2014 | work=MedioTiempo | language=Spanish}}</ref> Goya Kong had only recently joined AAA making the Triplemanía XXIII her first major AAA appearance. Dinastía and Mini Psycho Clown had been working a long-running storyline prior to the show, including Dinastía successfully defending the AAA World Mini-Estrellas Championship against Mini Psycho Clown on June 28, 2015.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.cagematch.net/?id=1&nr=132856 | title=AAA TV-Taping | date=June 28, 2015 | accessdate=July 31, 2015 | work=cagematch}}</ref>
==2015 AAA Hall of Fame== {{see also|El Hijo del Perro Aguayo}} In the weeks leading up to Triplemanía XXIII AAA announced their intentions to induct El Hijo del Perro Aguayo (The Son of [[Perro Aguayo]]) , sometimes referred to as "Perro Aguayo Jr." into their [[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide#Hall of Fame|Hall of Fame]] at Triplemanía.<ref name=2015HoF>{{cite web | url=http://www.thegladiatores.com/?p=13540 | title=El Hijo del Perro Aguayo al salón de la Fama AAA | date=July 30, 2015 | accessdate=July 31, 2015 | work=The Gladiatores | language=Spanish}}</ref> Aguayo made his professional wrestling debut on June 18, 1995 at [[Triplemanía III-B]].<ref name="Trip3B">{{cite web | url = http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/triple.html#iii-b | title = Asistencia Asesoría y Administración TripleManía | accessdate = March 21, 2015 | publisher = ProWrestlingHistory.com}}</ref> Having worked for AAA's biggest rival [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] (CMLL) for years El Hijo del Perro Aguayo returned to AAA 2010 at [[Triplemanía XVIII]] leading his ''[[Los Perros del Mal]]'' group in an invasion storyline. Over the following years Aguayo Jr. was one of AAA's top ''rudo'' workers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.luchalibreaaa.com/triplemaniaxviii.html|title=Triplemanía XVIII: Fiesta de Fiestas|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100815092851/http://www.luchalibreaaa.com/triplemaniaxviii.html|archivedate=August 15, 2010|date=June 7, 2010|accessdate=October 17, 2010|language=Spanish|work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]]}}</ref> During a match on March 20, 2015, Aguayo hit the ring ropes wrong after a drop kick from Rey Mysterio Jr. and later died from the injuries suffered during the match.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Mullen|first1=Jethro|title=Mexican wrestling star Hijo del Perro Aguayo dies after kick in ring|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/03/22/americas/mexico-wrestling-hijo-del-perro-aguayo-death/|publisher=[[CNN]]|accessdate=July 13, 2015}}</ref>
On August 6, AAA announced [[Héctor Garza]] as the second Hall of Fame inductee in the class of 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/luchalibreaaa/status/629332540382277632|title=Héctor Garza y @SoyHijoDelPerro serán inducidos al Salón de la Fama AAA en #TriplemaniaXXIII|work=[[Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide]]|publisher=[[Twitter]]|date=August 6, 2015|accessdate=August 6, 2015}}</ref>
==Event== {| class=wikitable style="margin: 0.5em 0 0.5em 1em; float: right; clear: right;" |+Other on-screen talent |- !Role !Name |- |rowspan=4|Spanish language<br>commentators |Arturo Rivera |- |Andrés Maroñas |- |Leonardo Riaño |- |Jesús Zuñiga |- |rowspan=2|English language<br>commentators |[[Matt Striker]] |- |[[Hugo Savinovich]] |- |rowspan=5|Referees |[[Pepe Casas]] |- |El Hijo de Tirantes |- |Copetes Salazar |- |Piero |- |Rafa El Maya |- |Ring Announcer |Armando Gaitán |}
The English language broadcast of Triplemanía XXIII experienced extended periods of time with audio problems, at times neither of the commentators were heard, at other times only [[Matt Striker]] could be heard and at one point there was a prolonged buzzing sound on the English language broadcast. It has not been confirmed if the Spanish language broadcast suffered from the same audio issues.<ref name=PWTM23/> The broadcast also suffered from some video issues especially early in the fourth match of the night involving Blue Demon Jr., La Parka, Electroshock and Mesisas.<ref name=PWTM23/> The Triplemanía XXIII stage set resembled the nose of a large cargo plane with wrestlers walking down steps through an opening in the front of the plan, then proceeding down what was described as the ''[[Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation]]'' runway, a ramp that resembled an airport runway. [[File:Sin cara firmando autografos.jpg|left|thumb|[[Místico|Myzteziz]], the other half of the "Dream Match" main event, who turned ''rudo'' after the match]] For his entrance prior to the main event Myzteziz was lowered from the ceiling wearing a harness, holding a pose similar to that of Ethan Hunt (portrayed by [[Tom Cruise]]) from the first ''[[Mission Impossible (film)|Mission Impossible]]'' movie. Once he landed on the ground and was unhooked he revealed a half black/half white version of his normal wrestling gear, alluding to comments made prior to the show that he may or may not work as a ''tecnico'' for the match.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2015/08/06/voy-a-humillar-a-rey-mysterio-myzteziz | title=Voy a humillar a Rey Mysterio: Myzteziz | date=August 6, 2015 | accessdate=August 10, 2015 | work=MedioTiempo | publisher=[[MSN]] | language=Spanish | first= Apolo | last=Valdés}}</ref> Initially Rey Mysterio Jr. took control of the match, much to Myzteziz's frustration, with Myzteziz only gaining control of the match by using punches, kicks and other ''rudo'' tactics. This drew boos from the crowd as they were vocally behind Rey Mysterio Jr. At one point during the match Myzteziz slammed Rey Mysterio Jr. onto of the English Language commentator's table, and at another point he [[suplex]]ed Mysterio Jr. out of the ring, through a table. At one point Rey Mysterio Jr. threw Myzteziz into one of the ring posts, making it look like Myzteziz hit his head on the metal. While the cameras were focusing on Rey Mysterio Jr. Myzteziz made it look like the impact had cut his forehead open as blood (or a similar red substance) covered the white portion of his mask. Once the two wrestlers returned to the ring Rey Mysterio Jr. started to tear at Myzteziz's mask, tearing it open around the eye holds. Late in the match Rey Mysterio Jr. managed to apply Myzteziz's finishing hold, the ''La Mistica'' [[Professional wrestling holds#Fujiwara armbar|Fujiwara armbar]], on Myzteziz but did not gain a submission from the move. Later on Mysterio Jr. managed to apply ''La Mistica'' once more, this time with Myzteziz being forced to tap out. As Mysterio Jr. celebrated on the floor Averno, Pentagón Jr. and [[Joe Lider]] ran to the ring to attack Myzteziz while he was down. When Rey Mysterio Jr. noticed the attack he entered the ring and helped Myzteziz fight off the ''rudo'' trios. When Mysterio Jr. offered a handshake Myzteziz spit a liquid in Mysterio's eyes and then declared that he did not care about the fans or Rey Mysterio Jr. He later challenged Mysterio to put his mask on the line in a ''Luchas de Apuestas'' match. As the show went off the air Myzteziz declined to join [[Konnan]]'s ''[[La Sociedad]]'', stating he was on his own.<ref name=PWTM23/><ref name=WrestleViewTM23/><ref name=TM23SL/>
==Reception== In the minutes after the PPV ended ''Lucha Libre'' journalist Apolo Valdés, who writes for the sports website ''MedioTiempo'' commented on Twitter that he really did not like the show, he only liked the cage match.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://twitter.com/apolovaldes/status/630565056242020352 | title=La verdad no me gustó #TriplemaniaXXIII sólo me gustó la de jaula, la estelar sólo los momentos finales | first=Apolo | last=Valdés | publisher=[[Twitter]] | date=August 9, 2015 | accessdate=August 9, 2015 | language=Spanish}}</ref> Josh Boutwell, reviewing the show for wrestleview stated the second match of the night involving ''Los Villanos'' was a "trainwreck". He also noted that the ''Apuestas'' match was "awesome" and that the main event was a great match despite a couple of clunky spots." He also noted that the PPV broadcast suffered from several technical issues, primarily with the sound on the English commentary and occasionally also issues with the picture quality. In the end he gave the Mysterio/Myzteziz match four stars out of five and rated the entire show as a "C+".<ref name=WrestleViewTM23/> James Caldewell of the Pro Wrestling Torch noted that the cage match "felt disorganized with so many people involved and a lot of standing around". Following the conclusion of the main event he commented that "more aimed at the live audience than translating to PPV". His final conclusion was " Not a recommended PPV. The last two matches had star-power and stories to carry the event once the technical difficulties were worked out, but the live atmosphere and significance of the event just did not seem to translate to PPV".<ref name=PWTM23/> Richard Gallegos, when writing an editorial for ''SuperLuchas'' Magazine, called Triplemanía XXIII "a disaster", both due to technical issues but also due to the fact that they were presenting a show to the US audience which have very little back story or build to four of the six matches, citing the ''Los Villanos''/''Los Psycho Circus'' match as one of the worst matches of the year. Summarizing he called it a "terrible experience" and that the production crew was a "monumental failure.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://superluchas.com/2015/08/10/el-desastre-llamado-triplemania-23/ | title=El desastre llamado Triplemania 23 | first=Ricardo | last=Gallegos | date=August 10, 2015 | accessdate=August 11, 2015 | work=SuperLuchas | language=Spanish}}</ref> [[Dave Meltzer]] of the ''[[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]]'' called the event "one of the worst PPV shows of all-time", stating "[t]his was a misfire to the level it's probably best for them to regroup and not try this again for some time". He gave the ''Los Villanos''/''Los Psycho Circus'' match a "minus five star" rating, calling it "one of the worst matches [he had] ever seen". He gave the main event three and three quarter stars out of five, his highest rating of the night. Meltzer, who had been approached by AAA to work as part of the English announcing team for the event, also stated that while he had sympathy for the announcers for the technical issues, he would not want them back, calling Matt Striker "terrible throughout" and stating that Hugo Savinovich was "off his game" in regard to clueing fans in on the storylines behind the matches.<ref>{{cite journal| last = Meltzer | first = Dave | authorlink = Dave Meltzer | date = August 17, 2015 | title = August 17, 2015 Wrestling Observer Newsletter: Summerslam build, Unions courting UFC fighters, more | journal = [[Dave Meltzer#Wrestling Observer Newsletter|Wrestling Observer Newsletter]] | location = [[Campbell, California]] | issn = 1083-9593 | pages=14–24}}</ref> Readers of the ''Wrestling Observer Newsletter'' voted the match between ''Los Psycho Circus'' and ''Los Villanos'' the 2015 [[List of Wrestling Observer Newsletter awards#Worst Worked Match of the Year|Worst Match of the Year]] and the entire event as the Worst Major Wrestling Show.<ref>{{cite journal| last = Meltzer | first = Dave | authorlink = Dave Meltzer | date = January 25, 2016 | title = January 25, 2016 Wrestling Observer Newsletter: 2015 Observer Awards Issue | journal = [[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]] | location = [[Campbell, California]] | issn = 1083-9593 | page=42}}</ref>
==Results== {{Pro Wrestling results table |results=<ref name=PWTM23>{{cite web | url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/otherppvs/article_86815.shtml | title=CALDWELL'S AAA TRIPLEMANIA 23 PPV REPORT: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of Mysterio vs. Original Sin Cara, Alberto vs. Brian Cage, Aguayo, Jr. & Hector Garza remembered, more | date=August 9, 2015 | accessdate=August 9, 2015 | first=James | last=Caldwel | publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}}</ref><ref name=WrestleViewTM23>{{cite web | url=http://www.wrestleview.com/featured-articles/55679-aaa-triplemania-xxiii-results-review | title=AAA TripleMania XXIII Results & Review | date=August 9, 2015 | accessdate=August 9, 2015 | first=Josh | last=Boutwell | publisher=WrestleView}}</ref><ref name=TM23SL>{{cite web | url=http://superluchas.com/2015/08/09/aaa-triplemania-xxiii-cobertura-y-resultados-lucha-de-ensueno-rey-mysterio-vs-myzteziz/ | title=AAA Triplemania XXIII (Cobertura y resultados) – Rey Mysterio vence a Myzteziz | first=Eduardo | last=Cano Vela | date=August 9, 2015 | accessdate=August 9, 2015 | work=SuperLuchas | language=Spanish}}</ref>

'''University of Redwood''' is a fictitious college claiming to be located in Oregon in the United States. It can be confused with [[Reed College]] in [[Portland, Oregon]], or the [[College of the Redwoods]] in [[Eureka, California]].
The Redwood website copies the Reed website, except it substitutes the institution's name.<ref name=wsj>{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748704692904576166833446761162|title=College Cries Foul Over a Copycat|first=Kevin|last=Helliker|work=Wall Street Journal|date=February 26–27, 2011|page=A3}}</ref> However, on at least the About page, the copiers failed and at one point left the Reed name intact.<ref name=che>{{citation |url=http://chronicle.com/blogs/wiredcampus/reed-college-seeks-to-stop-copycat-web-site/29999?sid=at|title=Reed College Seeks to Stop Copycat Web Site| work=Wired Campus blog | publisher=Chronicle of Higher Education|first=Ben |last=Wieder|date=February 24, 2011| accessdate=2011-02-27}}</ref> The street address and phone numbers for Reed's Cooley Art Gallery remain intact on the Redwood site.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uredwood.com/cooley_gallary.php|title=Cooley Gallery - Redwood University|publisher=Redwood University|accessdate=2011-02-27|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110227005821/http://uredwood.com/cooley_gallary.php|archivedate=2011-02-27 }} copied from {{cite web|url=http://www.reed.edu/gallery/|title=Cooley Gallery - Reed College|publisher=Reed College|accessdate=2011-02-27}}</ref> At one point, the entire faculty directory of Reed was listed on the Redwood site.<ref name=wsj/> While Reed was founded by Simeon and Amanda Reed, Redwood was founded by Simeon and Amanda Redwood.<ref name=che/><ref name=kgw>{{cite news|url=http://www.kgw.com/news/local/Reed-College-Website-Cloned-By-Scammers-117025028.html|title=Reed College website cloned by scammers in China|first=Wayne |last=Havrelly|date=February 27, 2011|work=KGW News|accessdate=2011-02-28}}</ref>
As first reported by ''Inside Higher Ed'',<ref>http://www.insidehighered.com/news/2011/02/24/qt#252136</ref> at least one man living in China created the Redwood site in June 2010.<ref name=kgw/> Reed first discovered the Redwood site in October 2010 and sent letters to Redwood's [[internet service provider]] under the [[Digital Millennium Copyright Act]] demanding that the [[copyright]]ed materials be taken down. The site was removed within a few days.<ref name=che/> However, the site was restored in November when its owners claimed that the infringing materials were removed.<ref name=che/> Reed officials rediscovered the site in January 2011; as of February 2011 they once again were able to have the site taken down.<ref name=che/> According to Martin Ringle, chief technology officer of Reed, the site could be used to collect admission application fees fraudulently from Asian students.<ref name=wsj/> Upon receiving an application, "a shrewd scammer could wait several weeks, then issue a rejection letter, and the student would never know" that Redwood did not exist.<ref name=wsj/> Ringle claimed he found Redwood mentioned on Asian higher-education [[blog]]s.<ref name=wsj/>
The Redwood website lists a mailing address in [[Torrance, California]], that belongs to a [[mail-forwarding]] company.<ref name=wsj/> That company forwards the mail to [[China]].<ref name=kgw/> It also lists a [[fax]] number with a [[area code 650|650 area code]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uredwood.com/|title=University of Redwood|publisher=University of Redwood|accessdate=2011-02-27|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110213023612/http://uredwood.com/|archivedate=2011-02-13}}</ref> which is assigned to the Bay Area south of [[San Francisco, California]].
==References== <references/>

page.title: World War II in Yugoslav Macedonia

revision.text:
{{For|other uses of terms redirecting here|Macedonian struggle}} {{more citations needed|date=October 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{Infobox military conflict |conflict = World War II in Yugoslav Macedonia |partof = [[World War II in Yugoslavia]] |image = Brigada Goce Delčev, Skopje 1944.jpg |caption = Partisans of the Goce Delčev Brigade marching through Skopje in November 1944. |date = 11 October 1941 – 23 November 1944
({{Age in years, months, weeks and days|month1=10|day1=11|year1=1941|month2=11|day2=23|year2=1944}}) |place = parts of the [[Macedonia (region)|wider region of Macedonia]] |territory = Part of [[Vardar Banovina]] ([[Vardar Macedonia]]) became [[SR Macedonia]] as part of [[SFR Yugoslavia]] |result = Yugoslav Partisan and Bulgarian victory *Formation of [[People's Republic of Macedonia|PR Macedonia]] as part of the [[SFR Yugoslavia]] |combatant1 = {{flagicon|Democratic Federal Yugoslavia}} [[Yugoslav Partisans|Partisans]]
* [[File:Flag of Macedonia (1944–1946).svg|23px|border]] [[People's Liberation Army of Macedonia|NOV]]
[[File:Flag of the Bulgarian Homeland Front.svg|23px|border]] [[Kingdom of Bulgaria|Bulgaria]] (from September 1944) |combatant2 = {{flagicon image|Chetniks Flag.svg}} [[Chetniks]] |combatant3 ={{plainlist| '''[[Axis Powers of World War II|Axis]]:''' * {{flagcountry|Kingdom of Bulgaria}} (until September 1944) * {{flagcountry|Nazi Germany|name=Germany}} * {{flagcountry|Kingdom of Italy}} (until September 1943) * {{Flag icon|Albania|1939}} [[Albania under Italy|Albanian Kingdom]] (until September 1943) * {{flagicon|Albania|1943}} [[German occupation of Albania|Albanian Kingdom]] (until November 1944) }} ---- '''[[Axis powers|Axis-affiliated]] [[Political faction|faction]]:'''
{{flagicon image|Chetniks Flag.svg}} [[Pećanac Chetniks]] ---- {{flagicon|Albania|1943}} [[Balli Kombëtar]] |commander1 = {{plainlist| *{{flagicon|Democratic Federal Yugoslavia}} [[Mihajlo Apostoloski]] (commander and leader of the Macedonian Partisans, commander de facto) *{{flagicon|Democratic Federal Yugoslavia}} [[Josip Broz Tito]] (limited influence and control, commander de jure) *{{flagicon|Democratic Federal Yugoslavia}} [[Svetozar Vukmanović-Tempo]] (link between Mihajlo Apostolski and Josip Broz Tito, supervisor) *{{flagicon|Democratic Federal Yugoslavia}} [[Metodija Andonov-Čento]] *[[File:Flag of the Bulgarian Homeland Front.svg|23px|border]] [[Vladimir Stoychev]] }} |commander2 = {{plainlist| *{{flagicon image|Chetniks Flag.svg}} [[Draža Mihailović]] *{{flagicon image|Chetniks Flag.svg}} [[Stojan Krstić]] }} |commander3 ={{plainlist| *{{flagicon|Kingdom of Bulgaria}}[[Bogdan Filov]] *{{flagicon|Kingdom of Bulgaria}}[[Nikola Mikhov]] *{{flagicon|Nazi Germany}} [[Alexander Löhr]] ---- *{{flagicon image|Chetniks Flag.svg}} [[Kosta Pećanac]] ---- *{{flagicon|Albania|1943}} [[Xhemo Hasa]]{{KIA}} *{{flagicon|Albania|1943}}[[Mefail Shehu]]{{KIA}} *{{flagicon|Albania|1943}}[[Gajur Deralla]]{{KIA}} }} |strength1 =1,000 (1941) - 8,000 (August 1944)Bulgaria During the Second World War, Marshall Lee Miller, Stanford University Press, 1975, p. 202.Who Are the Macedonians? Hugh Poulton, C. Hurst & Co. Publishers, 2000. p. 104. to 66,000 (late 1944)The Slavonic and East European review, School of Slavonic and East European Studies, University of London, 1991, p. 304. up to 100,000 (April 1945)Зимските операции на Македонска војска 1943/44 – Раде Гогов, носител на "Партизанска споменица 1941". |strength2 = ~100,000 (1945) ---- ~8,000 [[Chetniks]] |casualties1 = 6,724 dead |casualties2 = |notes = '''Total casualties:''' 24,000
'''By nationality:'''
(7,000 Jews, 6,724 [[Ethnic Macedonians]], 6,000 [[Serbs]], 4,000 [[Albanians]]) '''By affiliation:'''
(2,000 civilians, 1,000 [[Collaborationism|collaborationists]], 14,000 [[Yugoslav Partisans]] and [[Yugoslav army|Yugoslav soldiers]], 7,000 victims of concentration camps) '''Other:'''
(1,000 [[Bulgarians]], [[Aromanians]], [[Romani people|Roma]] and [[Turkish people|Turks]])Zerjavic, Vladimir. ''Yugoslavia Manipulations With the Number of Second World War Victims''. Croatian Information Centre, {{ISBN|0-919817-32-7}} [http://www.hic.hr/books/manipulations/p06.htm] |casus = [[Axis Powers of World War II|Axis]] occupation of [[Vardar Banovina]] |}} {{History of the Republic of Macedonia}} [[File:Bulgarian Macedonians.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Macedonians in Sofia posing with German soldiers after the invasion in Yugoslavia. The posters praise the unification with Bulgaria, and [[United Macedonia]]. When German troops advanced into Yugoslav Macedonia, the crowds in Skopje, displayed the same banners.Bulgaria During the Second World War, Author Marshall Lee Miller, Publisher Stanford University Press, 1975, {{ISBN|0804708703}}, p. 123.]] [[File:Bulgarians-entering-bitola-1941.jpg|250px|right|thumb|Bulgarian troops entering Bitola on April 21, 1941. In fact, they were greeted as alleged liberators from Serbian yoke, while pro-Bulgarian feelings prevailed during the early stages of the occupation.Raymond Detrez, The A to Z of Bulgaria, G - Reference, SCARECROW PRESS INC, 2010, {{ISBN|0810872021}}, p. 485.]] [[File:Axis occupation of Yugoslavia 1941-43.png|thumbnail|250px|right|Occupation and partition of Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941. Bulgaria annexed the central and eastern parts of Vardar Macedonia, while the westernmost part was occupied by the [[Kingdom of Italy (1861–1946)|Kingdom of Italy]].]] [[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 101I-161-0256-10, Balkan, Spähpanzer, bulgarische Soldaten.jpg|right|thumb|250px|Yugoslav POWs supervised by Bulgarian soldiers and German armored car.]] [[File:Italians Ochrid 1941 2.jpg|right|thumb|250px|Italian troops entering Ohrid on April 12, 1941.]] [[File:Timishoara Macedonian POWs.jpg|right|thumb|250px|Yugoslav Macedonian POWs in camp in Timishoara, May 1941, before their liberation. With the intercession of the Bulgarian administration more than 12,000 Macedonian POWs who had been conscripted into the Yugoslav army were released.]] '''World War II in Yugoslav Macedonia''' started with the [[Axis occupation of Yugoslavia]]. [[Macedonians (ethnic group)|Macedonian]] communist Partisans of the [[People's Liberation Army of Macedonia]], part of the [[Yugoslav Partisan movement]], started a political and [[military campaign]] on 11 October 1941 to resist the occupation of [[Vardar Macedonia]] by Bulgarian, German, Italian, and Albanian forces. Officially, the area was called then [[Vardar Banovina]], because the very name ''Macedonia'' was prohibited in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia.Donald Bloxham, The Final Solution: A Genocide, OUP Oxford, 2009, {{ISBN|0199550336}}, p. 65.Chris Kostov, Contested Ethnic Identity: The Case of Macedonian Immigrants in Toronto, Peter Lang, 2010, {{ISBN|3034301960}}, p. 76. Initially it had no real success, starting to grow only in 1943 with the capitulation of Italy and the Soviet victories over Nazi Germany.Bulgaria During the Second World War, Marshall Lee Miller, Stanford University Press, 1975, {{ISBN|0804708703}}, [https://books.google.com/books?id=HjSsAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA133 pp. 132–133.]Historical Dictionary of the Republic of Macedonia, Dimitar Bechev, Scarecrow Press, 2009, {{ISBN|0810862956}} [https://books.google.com/books?id=ilGfCIF4Ao4C&pg=PR63 introduction Ixiii.] The role of the Bulgarian communists, which avoided organizing mass armed resistance, was also a key factor.Viktor Meier, Yugoslavia: A History of Its Demise, Routledge, 2005, {{ISBN|1134665113}}, p. 181. Their influence over the Macedonian Party organization remained dominant until the spring of 1943 when Tito's special emissary [[Svetozar Vukmanović]] arrived in Macedonia.Dejan Djokić, Yugoslavism: histories of a failed idea, 1918-1992, Hurst, 2003, {{ISBN|1850656630}}, p. 120. This led to the rise of younger generation anti-Bulgarian oriented partisan leaders, who were loyal to Yugoslavia.Roumen Daskalov, Diana Mishkova ed., Entangled Histories of the Balkans - Volume Two, BRILL, 2013, {{ISBN|9004261915}}, p. 534. In the western part of the area, the [[Albanian Partisans]] also participated in the resistance movement. After Bulgaria switched sides in the war [[Bulgarian coup d'état of 1944|in September 1944]], the Bulgarian 5th. Army stationed in Macedonia, moved back to the old borders of Bulgaria. In the early October the newly formed [[Bulgarian People's Army]] together with the [[Red Army]] reentered occupied Yugoslavia to blocking the German forces withdrawing from Greece. Vardar Macedonia was liberated in end of November when [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|communist Yugoslavia]] was established. The operation was called the '''National Liberation War of Macedonia''' ({{lang-mk|Народноослободителна борба на Македонија, Narodnoosloboditelna borba na Makedonija}}) by the Partisans, in line with the greater [[Yugoslav People's Liberation War]], but combatants also developed further aspirations over the geographic region of [[Macedonia (region)|Macedonia]]. It marked the defeat of [[Bulgarian nationalism]] and the victory of [[Macedonism]] in the area. ==Background== The [[Balkan Wars]] in [[First Balkan War|1912]] and [[Second Balkan War|1913]], and the [[World War I]] (1914-1918) divided the region of Macedonia amongst the [[Kingdom of Greece]], the [[Kingdom of Bulgaria]] and the [[Kingdom of Serbia]]. The territory was up until that time part of the Ottoman Empire. In those days, the majority of the [[Slavic speakers in Ottoman Macedonia]] considered themselves to be a part of the [[Bulgarian Millet|Bulgarian people]].During the 20th century, Slavo-Macedonian national feeling has shifted. At the beginning of the 20th century, Slavic patriots in Macedonia felt a strong attachment to Macedonia as a multi-ethnic homeland. They imagined a Macedonian community uniting themselves with non-Slavic Macedonians... Most of these Macedonian Slavs also saw themselves as Bulgarians. By the middle of the 20th. century, however Macedonian patriots began to see Macedonian and Bulgarian loyalties as mutually exclusive. Regional Macedonian nationalism had become ethnic Macedonian nationalism... This transformation shows that the content of collective loyalties can shift.[https://books.google.com/books?id=6RveDmHbIv8C&pg=PA147 ''Region, Regional Identity and Regionalism in Southeastern Europe, Ethnologia Balkanica Series'', Klaus Roth, Ulf Brunnbauer, LIT Verlag Münster, 2010, p. 127.], {{ISBN|3825813878}}"At the end of the World War I there were very few historians or ethnographers, who claimed that a separate Macedonian nation existed... Of those Slavs who had developed some sense of national identity, the majority probably considered themselves to be Bulgarians, although they were aware of differences between themselves and the inhabitants of Bulgaria... The question as of whether a Macedonian nation actually existed in the 1940s when a Communist Yugoslavia decided to recognize one is difficult to answer. Some observers argue that even at this time it was doubtful whether the Slavs from Macedonia considered themselves to be a nationality separate from the Bulgarians.
